TEXT: The applicant is a NORP citizen born in DATE . He is currently living in GPE , a village near GPE , GPE .
The applicant is represented in the proceedings before the ORG by ORG , a firm of solicitors based in GPE .
A.
The facts as submitted by the parties may be summarised as follows .

The applicant has served as a retained fireman in ORG in the village of GPE for DATE . On DATE he was made ORG and Station Commander with managerial responsibility for the ORG fire station . All the fire - fighters at the ORG station work on a retained basis and all live in GPE , a community of CARDINAL inhabitants . The applicant was at the relevant time employed full - time as a bus driver in GPE . Fire service records indicate that the applicant spent , on average , TIME at work , including time spent attending fires and other incidents . According to the applicant , he spent considerably more time at the fire station than TIME recorded since as a Sub - Officer he had to attend to a host of other matters relating to the running of the station .

In a letter dated DATE addressed to ORG a male colleague made a complaint against the applicant accusing him of harassment . The applicant ’s colleague was interviewed on DATE . Certain of the allegations made against the applicant were subsequently confirmed by a leading fireman at the station who was also interviewed . A full disciplinary investigation was conducted into the allegation made against the applicant . On DATE the applicant was suspended from duty pending the outcome of the disciplinary proceedings .

Subsequently in a letter dated DATE a former female colleague of the applicant complained that the applicant and another member of the fire station had made unsavoury and personal comments of a very explicit sexual nature about her . That complaint also became part of the investigation .
The applicant denied all the accusations made against him .

During his period of suspension the applicant was prohibited from entering any fire service premises without obtaining prior permission and was requested that he should not , at any time , contact or speak to any of his service colleagues . He remained suspended on these terms until DATE , when the terms of the suspension were varied .

The applicant states that the terms imposed on his suspension placed considerable restrictions on his social and everyday life and prevented him from communicating with his friends and almost went as far as to prevent him from communicating with his family .

By way of illustration of the effects of the restriction , the applicant refers to an incident which occurred on DATE while he was present at a local club which counted among its members many of the fire - fighters from ORG . The applicant states that officers from the fire service entered the LOC , noted with whom he was associating and reported back to the fire service . A similar incident occurred shortly afterwards when he was present at the club with his son and wife together with CARDINAL of his fire service friends and their wives .

The applicant refers to a further incident on DATE when he attended the retirement party of a fire officer whom he had known for DATE and whose wife was known to his family for DATE . Other fire officers and their families were present . By letter dated DATE the fire service cautioned the applicant that any further reports to the effect that he had breached the conditions of his suspension would lead to charges being brought against him under ORG DATE .

In DATE the applicant was informed by ORG that he had to request permission to attend his son 's wedding because firemen whom his son had known from childhood , and one of whom was his Best Man , were also invited to the wedding . On this occasion a senior officer granted a relaxation of the conditions of the applicant 's suspension and permitted him to associate with friends and colleagues from ORG on DATE of the wedding .

After hearing witnesses and the applicant on CARDINAL and DATE , the disciplinary tribunal found each of the charges proven and the disciplinary action taken against him justified . He was sentenced to a reduction in rank to fire - fighter . He appealed to ORG which modified the disciplinary sanction to reduction in rank to leading fire - fighter . On DATE the applicant submitted notice of his appeal to the Secretary of ORG . The appeal had not yet been decided at the time of the ORG ’s consideration of the applicant ’s complaints .

In a letter dated DATE ORG notified the applicant that the terms of his suspension had been varied and that he was henceforth permitted to have contacts with his fellow officers but was not to discuss the circumstances of the disciplinary proceedings until the appeal to the Home Secretary had been determined . The applicant continues not to be permitted to enter fire service LOC .
B. Relevant domestic law and practice

ORG DATE ( ORG no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL ) made pursuant to section CARDINAL of FAC DATE provide for the maintenance of discipline in fire brigades and set out a code of discipline and the procedures to be followed for the investigation and the taking of disciplinary action against members of the fire service .

The terms under which a fire officer can be suspended are contained in section LAW of ORG for ORG Scheme of ORG ( “ ORG ” ) . These conditions formed part of the contract between the applicant and ORG . Under the relevant provisions of section LAW the County Fire Officer ( “ the Chief Officer ” ) may suspend a fire officer who has committed a disciplinary or criminal offence . The period of suspension continues until it is either terminated by the Chief Officer or until disciplinary proceedings have been concluded .
The NJC Terms of ORG do not deal with the imposition of terms in connection with the suspension of a fire officer .

In DATE the fire service published a Fair Treatment Policy setting out procedures to enable employees to raise matters of concern with their superior officers in the service . The ORG implements an outline grievance procedure set out in section X of the ORG terms of service . Under the Policy any grievance is to be pursued in the first instance with the employee ’s line manager . If dissatisfied , the employee may then take the matter up with the Manager , then ORG and finally with the appropriate committee of ORG .
